sub_title: Product Manager at Backbase, Ecosystems Integrations
summary: Self-driven and motivated IT Product Owner/Business Analyst with a solid background in Academic Research; specialization in data gathering, data analysis and solution design - Implementation of Qualitative Research and Agile Methodologies.

profile_positions.description:
Partnership activities between Backbase and Microsoft; identification of strategic areas of integration between the Backbase Engagement Banking Platform and the Microsoft Ecosystem, such as Dynamics 365 Cloud for FSI, OpenAI/LLM, PowerBI and Azure Communication Services, resulting into the creation of a longterm product vision and roadmap
Sales Enablement for Microsoft Integrations, involvement in client pitches during pre-Sales and Sales cycles
Implementation of Core Banking integrations between the Backbase Engagement Banking Platform and Mambu/ThoughtMachine
Managing the team of the API Management Platform for the Connectivity-as-a-Service initiative
profile_positions.title: Product Manager - Ecosystems Integrations

profile_positions.description:
Delivery of the first Reporting functionalities in the Backbase R&D product: problem statement definition, conceptual design, multi-disciplinary stakeholder alignment, RFP/RFI analysis, as well as initial and subsequent releases
Onboarding, Origination and Lending SME in pre-Sales and Implementation projects, responsible for client presentations, requirements refinement, and up-skilling peers and internal stakeholders
Design and implementation of the first retail and business lending functionalities for Onboarding and Origination flows
profile_positions.title: Product Manager - Onboarding and Origination

profile_positions.description:
Product Owner
• All‑round feature implementation of two Mortgage Origination platforms under the bijBouwe and Dynamic Verhuurhypotheek labels
• Ensuring alignment between the development team and end‑users/business stakeholders; working closely with software engineers on high level system architecture and with business stakeholders on gap analysis and requirements specification
• Management of the product life cycle and roadmap, from conceptual and process design to UAT organization and release within an Agile framework
• Owner of Sprint Refinement, Prioritization, Planning and Review ceremonies
• Co‑ordinator of integrations with external systems and third‑party services: consultancy, business case creation, market research and liaise with potential vendors

OKR Coach
• Translation of business Strategies and Objectives into Key Results and relevant Initiatives, and further facilitation and task allocation to Business and Development teams
• Development, implementation and continuous improvement of the cross-team process framework

Agile Coach
• Facilitation of all business teams within the Organization in order to structure their day-to-day work and link it to the long-term business strategies within an adapted Agile framework
• Acting Scrum Master: supporting other Product Owners and individual team members to develop and structure their roadmaps in order to achieve their business targets through Scrum artefacts and ceremonies
profile_positions.title: IT Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Definition of business requirements for IT development in close collaboration with several stakeholder teams in the form of backlog items/user stories
• Quality assurance by designing and performing acceptance tests
• Design, development and documentation of loan processes, from loan application to servicing
• Risk identification and continuous improvements of business and IT processes
profile_positions.title: IT Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
• Design, testing, deployment, support and on-site implementation of the internal KYC SaaS tool for the biggest banks in Ireland and the Netherlands
• Gap analysis and identification of specific (user) requirements in collaboration with the banks’ intermediary consultants
• Management and planning of the UAT cycles with external testers and intermediaries (business users) to ensure committed deadlines and deliverables
• Assurance of the viability, functionality and effectiveness of the KYC SaaS tool and incident management
• Creation of company's DEMO materials (promo products)
profile_positions.title: Systems Analyst - Junior Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
• Research Project “Greek Paideia: Development of Language Teaching Curricula for the
Greek Community of Toronto, Canada”.
• Responsible for the writing of language teaching material for the High School classes.
• Worked remotely 100% of the time
• Supervisors: Prof. dr. Konstantinos Ntinas and Prof. dr. Eleni Griva.
profile_positions.title: Junior Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Department of Culture Studies, School of Humanities, Tilburg University
• Teaching Assistant at the MA course Intimacy, Privacy and Authenticity
(supervisors: Prof. Dr. Odile Heynders, Dr. Piia Varis).
• Member of the editorial team of the Department of Culture Studies e-zine
“Diggit!”.
• Conducting research and PhD proposal writing under the supervision of Prof. Dr.
Odile Heynders, Dr. Piia Varis and in collaboration with Prof. Dr. Ad Backus.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Department of Culture Studies, School of Humanities, Tilburg University
[Tilburg, the Netherlands]
• Research Assistant at the KNAW Research Traineeship Program “Identity
Representation and Attraction on Tinder” (Supervisors: dr. Alexander Schouten and dr.
Piia Varis).
• Responsible for the research design; questionnaire design, data collection online and
through participant observation, conducting interviews, transcribing audio and video
recordings, analysis of qualitative and quantitative data (Grounded Theory and SPSS),
results reporting.
★ Achievement: Submission of two academic articles (qualitative and quantitative) at the
scientific journal “New Media and Society” and presentation of the project at the
“Etmaal van Communicatiewetenschap” conference in Amsterdam, 2016.
profile_positions.title: Research Trainee

profile_positions.description:
Department of Culture Studies, School of Humanities, Tilburg University
[Tilburg, the Netherlands]
• Research Assistant at the KNAW Research Traineeship Program “Data Activism: Data
Journalism and Society”, Project Title: The case study of Indymedia Athens and the
discourse of hidden Indymedia (Supervisor: dr. Stefania Milan).
• Responsible for the research design; questionnaire design, data collection online and
through participant observation, conducting interviews, transcribing audio and video
recordings, analysis of qualitative data (Discourse Analysis and Ethnography), results
reporting.
★ Achievement: Participation at the “Workshop on Data Journalism: Transforming Data
Into Stories” at Medialab Prado, Madrid, 25-27 October 2013.
profile_positions.title: Research Trainee

profile_positions.description:
School of Humanities, Tilburg University
• Curriculum Committee Member as Student Representative for the “Research
Master’s Program “Language and Communication”
profile_positions.title: Student Representative – Curriculum Committee Member

profile_positions.description:
• Research Project “Greek Paideia: Development of Language Teaching Curricula - Curricula for the Greek Community of Toronto, Canada”.
• Responsible for researching and providing reports on Greek Language Teaching Curricula and The European Common Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR).
• Worked remotely 100% of the time
• Supervisors: Prof. dr. Sofronis Hatzisavidis and Prof. dr. Eleni Griva.
profile_positions.title: Junior Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Research project by Prof. dr. Dimitrios Koutsogiannis on the use of Information  Technologies by Greek High School students in curricular and extra-curricular activities.
• Responsible for data collection through participant observations in classrooms, conducting interviews, transcribing interviews and in-classroom audio recordings, organizing team presentations, meetings and workshops.
• Supervisor: Prof. dr. Dimitrios Koutsogiannis
profile_positions.title: Junior Research Assistant
